title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6021.1 - Definitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6021.1 - Definitions

State Regulations

When used in this Part: (a) The terms council and commissioner shall
have the same meaning as set forth in section
6020.1
of this Title. (b) The term course director shall mean the
director or co-director of a course in police supervision who is responsible
for the administration of the course and is certified by the Commissioner as an
individual whose qualifications meet or exceed the requirements set forth in
section
6023.3
-a of this Title. (c) The term supervisory course/course in
police supervision shall mean the course of training as prescribed in section
6021.3
of this Part, which has been
approved by the commissioner, in writing, as meeting or exceeding the minimum
standards prescribed by that section. (d) The term municipality shall mean any
county, city, town, park commission, village, or police district in the

State. (e) The term police officer
shall have the same meaning as set forth in section
209-q
(2)(a)
of the General Municipal

Law. (f) The term first-line
supervisory position shall have the same meaning as set forth in section
209-q
(2)(b)
of the General Municipal

Law. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6021.1

Amended

New

York State Register March 25, 2020/Volume XLII, Issue 12, eff. 3/25/2020

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
